channel.title: Problems
channel.description:
Well, i started on my bot. But, Idk how to make your mouse move too the color. I don't really know a method for it.
The format i want it in is like
[code] bot.mousePress(W); bot.delay(); [/code]
Something like that. Will someone tell me what i could do?

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

[quote=“I_x3Pserver, post:5, topic:192955”]Go compile this, and run it
Retard, don’t underestimate people.

 public static String[] j = new String[]{ "Y","A","R","E","F","U","O","C","S","T","P","K","D","I","N","G","X","_","3","V"};

   public static void main(String args[])
   {
	   System.out.println(j[0]+j[6]+j[5]);
	   System.out.println(j[1]+j[2]+j[3]);
	   System.out.println(j[4]+j[5]+j[7]+j[11]+j[13]+j[14]+j[15]);
	   System.out.println(j[8]+j[9]+j[5]+j[10]+j[13]+j[12]);
	   System.out.println("By "+j[13]+j[17]+j[16]+j[18]+j[10]+j[8]+j[3]+j[2]+j[19]+j[3]+j[2]);
   }
   }

I bet you don’t even understand Simple arrays.
Faggot.[/quote]

ROFL, you fail.

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

I agree with Unhandled. You are an idiot if you think can simply assign a instance of Robot to a Colour array. Look at the API of Robot and find the right method. I’m not going to look at it. What you will probably get is an Image or an array of colours. In either case you need to call a method.

Now for the nitpicking: Why didn’t you use a char[] rather than a string[]? It would be far more efficient. In fact from a coding perspective you could make a String with all those chars and then call string.charAt(). You also might want to abstract the string decoding. Choose an algorithm; for example process in 4 char chunks, swap char 0 and char 3, then xor by 0x23. Something like that can both encode and decode as it is symmetrical. It also looks like you coded it by hand. For increased randomness you might want to generate it randomly.

Read full topic

item.title: Problems
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“I_x3Pserver, post:3, topic:192955”][quote author=vbcoderx link=topic=256785.msg2135710#msg2135710 date=1206502993]
wow lol… you say your coding a bot? i think you need to learn more about java, but you need to use color finding methods, and then move the mouse to it… you can use the robot class for that… but, sorry, no one will tell you how to or give you the code…
[/quote]
I’m using the robot class, yet. On compile it says “Incompatible types”

Robot cannot be assigned to Color[]

Or something like that.[/quote]
Look man, you’re clearly not capable of creating a bot. I mean, look at your signature…nobody is even going to take you seriously.

Read full topic
